instruction: As a financial analyst, please research and analyze the impact of the cessation of USD LIBOR after June 30, 2023 on our company's floating-rate securitizations indexed to LIBOR. Based on your research, recommend alternative reference rates for our securitizations and provide a detailed report on how this change will affect our company's cash flows.
output: As per the recent announcements from the Financial Conduct Authority (FCA) and the ICE Benchmark Administration, USD overnight and 1-, 3-, 6-, and 12-month LIBOR tenors are scheduled to cease after June 30, 2023. As a result of these announcements, floating-rate securitizations indexed to USD LIBOR will be affected. The Alternative Reference Rates Committee (ARRC) has recommended that after June 30, 2021, there should be no floating-rate securitizations indexed to USD LIBOR. Therefore, our company needs to consider alternative reference rates to minimize the risk of market disruptions. The Secured Overnight Financing Rate (SOFR) has been recommended by the ARRC as a replacement for USD LIBOR. SOFR is based on transactions in the Treasury repurchase market and reflects the cost of borrowing cash overnight on a secured basis. Our company needs to consider transitioning our floating-rate securitizations indexed to SOFR to avoid disruptions in the market. I recommend conducting a thorough analysis of our outstanding floating-rate securitizations and identifying any potential risks associated with the transition. Additionally, we need to evaluate the impact of the LIBOR cessation on our company's cash flows and ensure that our financial reporting complies with the new regulations. I will provide a detailed report on the impact of the USD LIBOR cessation on our company's cash flows and recommendations for alternative reference rates.
